thread.title: Majority of Louisiana Legislature elected without opposition
thread.title_full: Majority of Louisiana Legislature elected without opposition | NOLA.com

author: Julia O'Donoghue, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune
title: Majority of Louisiana Legislature elected without opposition
text:
More than half of the Louisiana Legislature will automatically get to take their seats because they face no opposition in the 2015 election.
Fifty-three of Louisiana's 105 state representatives and 21 of Louisiana's 39 state senators face no opponent in the Oct. 24 primary.
Most of the New Orleans area state senators and representatives aren't facing opposition. Sens. J.P. Morrell, Karen Carter Peterson, Danny Martiny and Jack Donahue have been automatically elected because no one else is running their races.
Reps. Scott Simon, Kevin Pearson, John Schroeder, Julie Stokes, Cameron Henry, Bryan Adams, Greg Cromer, Walt Leger, Tom Willmott, Helena Moreno, Sherman Mack, Neil Abramson and Paul Hollis also get to keep their seats because no one is challenging them.
Conrad Appel, R-Metairie, is the only local senator to face opposition in the primary, though there is also one open senate seat in the New Orleans area. Sen. David Heitmeier is stepping down. His open Senate district includes portions of Algiers, Gretna, Terrytown, Harvey and Belle Chasse.
. . . . .
Julia O'Donoghue is a state politics reporter based in Baton Rouge. She can be reached at jodonoghue@nola.com or on Twitter at @jsodonoghue . Please consider following us on Facebook at NOLA.com .
